meanings.definition: To cause a feeling of disgust or horror.
meanings.sent1: The sight of the rotten food made me revulse.
meanings.sent2: The gruesome scene in the movie made me revulse.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs might revulse some people.
meanings.sent4: The revolting smell of the garbage bin revulsed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the food was enough to revulse even the bravest eater.

meanings.definition: To pull away in disgust or horror.
meanings.sent1: I revulsed at the touch of the slimy slug.
meanings.sent2: She revulsed from the creepy crawly bug on her arm.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected cold water made him revulse and jump back.
meanings.sent4: The shocking news made her revulse in disbelief.
meanings.sent5: The revulsing sensation of touching the sticky substance made her shudder.
